thread.title: Jewish Entrepreneur Funds Mayor de Blasio’s Trip to Israel
thread.title_full: Jewish Entrepreneur Funds Mayor de Blasio’s Trip to Israel

author: Ryan Haas
title: Jewish Entrepreneur Funds Mayor de Blasio’s Trip to Israel
text:
Share 
After a slew of stabbings in Israel, the head of an Israeli investment group has volunteered to cover the cost of Mayor Bill de Blasio’s upcoming three-day trip to Israel in an effort to speak out against anti-Semitism. 
Eli Gross, founder and chairman of Jerusalem’s Besadno Group, will be covering travel and hotel expenses for de Blasio and his staff, who are scheduled to arrive in Israel on Friday, Oct. 16th. De Blasio will take part in the Annual Conference of Mayors, at which he’ll be a keynote speaker to address the topic of “Anti-Semitism in the West: How Cities Must Lead.” 
In a statement given to JP, Gross mentioned de Blasio’s long history of standing up against anti-Semitic acts. 
“I’m honored to join Mayor de Blasio in his fight against anti-Semitism and in support of tolerance,” Gross told JP. “New York City can provide other cities with a model for protecting all communities against hate. I look forward to the mayor’s visit and his remarks in Jerusalem.” 
The conference, which offers an opportunity for dozens of mayors around the world to discuss current issues and challenges, is being hosted by the American Jewish Congress, American Council for World Jewry and World Forum of Russian-Speaking Jewry. 
The cost of the trip could have been covered by the city due to both security and anti-Semitism are continued sources of concern in New York City, but instead was paid for by Gross. The NYPD will foot the bill as it pertains to security costs associated with the trip. 
Gross, who has over 30 years of experience as a business entrepreneur, has established companies in the United States, Europe and Israel.
